name: Field Renamer
description: Renames the fields of a data set given a list of current names and new names.
introductoryText:
With this block, fields of a data set can be renamed according to a set of rules.

## First input:
The first input specifies a data set containing the rules. Each record is a field rename operation. The data set must contain two fields: One field specifies the current field name, the second field specifies the new field name.

Example:

Current Name, New Name
–––––––––––––––––––––
Category, New Category
Isin, Isin Number 
Something else, Something renamed

## Second input:
The second input specifies the data set whose fields are to be renamed.
Example:

Index, Category, Name, Isin
–––––––––––––––––––––
1, Subordinated, ABBEY, XS0076061927 
2, Subordinated, HBOS, XS0070530885

## Output:
After execution, the first output would look like this:

Index, New Category, Name, Isin Number
––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––
1, Subordinated, ABBEY, XS0076061927 
2, Subordinated, HBOS, XS0070530885

The second output specifies the fields defined in the rules which were not found in the data set. Similarly the third output specifies fields in the data set for which no rules were found.
